results.title: Butterfly women
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976-1980 Olympic & world class swimmers”.
The swimmers Tracey Caulkins, Joan Pennington, Nancy Hogshead and Cynthia Woodhead are shown in action from above and below the waterline demonstrating the butterfly stroke. Includes booklet.

results.title: Butterfly
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976-1980 Olympic & world class swimmers”.
One of a series of films which shows swimmers, and their styles and techniques. Slow motion is used to clarify the demonstrations. This film concentrates on butterfly swimming. Swimmers featured include Mike Bruner, Steve Gregg and Joe Bottom.
results.description:
Episode of Series “1976-1980 Olympic & world class swimmers”.
One of a series of films which shows swimmers, and their styles and techniques. Slow motion is used to clarify the demonstrations. This film concentrates on butterfly swimming. Swimmers featured include Mike Bruner, Steve Gregg and Joe Bottom.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “1976-1980 Olympic & world class swimmers”.

results.title: Breaking up
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenwald, George Moffly, Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Regency Entertainment (USA)
results.brief_description: Using vignettes, still photos, interviews, and the New York landscape, this film follows the trials and tribulations of Steve (Russell Crowe) and Monica’s (Salma Hayek) tumultuous relationship that vacillates between being together, and breaking up. The two realise that they can’t live with each other, but can’t do without the other either and are trapped in a continuous process of breaking up then making up. Ultimately, they have to decide what it is that’s holding them together when the excitement of their renewed sexual attraction that occurs when they make up seems to be the overarching link between them. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner Michael Cristofer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Greenwald, George Moffly, Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Regency Entertainment (USA)

results.title: Breaking through...
results.creator_credit: Jackie McKimmie, Richard Mason and Alfred Road Films
results.brief_description: Cathy Ann Matthews had only pleasant and peaceful recollections of her childhood. Not until her own daughter was getting married did the memories of the past come flooding back. This sensitive and moving docu-drama is about a woman coming to terms with the horrible abuse she went through as a child and deals with the way these memories flooded her mind until she became almost suicidal. Stars Deidre Rubenstein, Tony Barry, Gabrielle Mason, Julie Hamilton and Noni Hazlehurst. Based on the book ‘Breaking though: no longer a victim of child abuse’ by Cathy Ann Matthews.
